header.title: The Scroll of Set - December 1998
header.category: Western Esotericism, Left-Hand Path, Setian Philosophy, Practical Magic

central_thesis: The 'Scroll of Set - December 1998' serves as a vital internal document for the Temple of Set, showcasing the diverse applications of its core philosophy, Xeper (self-creation and Becoming), across various practical and theoretical magical disciplines. It emphasizes the Left-Hand Path of individual godhood, providing both specific techniques for magical development (e.g., conscious visualization, adapted Vajrayana practices, specific Black Magic rules) and broader strategic guidance for its initiates in navigating the mundane and occult worlds.

structure_content.chapter_title: [1] Casting Pearls Before Swine: The alt.satanism Working
structure_content.summary: Advocates for Setians to cease engaging in public alt.satanism forums on the Internet to preserve the authenticity and dignity of the Temple of Set. It proposes a two-step 'working' of disengagement and redirection of energy towards internal Temple activities and creation of permanent monuments of Setian thought.

Introduces dance as a dynamic magical tool for trance induction and expressing magical will. It highlights its LHP nature, utility in group rituals for synchronicity, and effectiveness without requiring scarce resources.

Proposes an initiatory project to explore and apply properties of Buddhist Vajrayana (Tibetan Buddhism/Bon, Japanese Shingon/Tendai, Ch'an/Zen) to the Setian goal of Xeper, focusing on meditative stability and Yidam (idealized divine self) meditation.

Discusses the Hawaii Conclave, explores 'Concerning Lesser Black Magic' as granting permission for others' magic to work, and 'Concerning Working in the World' as consciously sending one's deeds into the Well of Wyrd for Remanifestation. It also touches on the nature of art in the Temple.

structure_content.chapter_title: [13] Being A Treatise on the Conjuring of Certain Demons
structure_content.summary: Presents a Left-Hand Path approach to 'conjuring demons' not as external entities from Hell, but as internal entities birthed from one's own nature, to be befriended, named, and given 'flesh' through the magician's skin. It critiques traditional ceremonial magic's external accouterments.

Offers an annual magical checklist for Setians, including rereading key texts (Black Magic, Protocol, ICR), assessing personal magical progress, planning for the Temple, burying hatchets, and cursing real enemies, all to establish a strong magical foundation for the coming year.

Explores Ouspensky's concepts of 'Awareness' (noticing the functions of Emotional, Moving, Instinctive, Intellectual self) and 'Conscious Visualization' (consciously imagining non-existent states/capabilities to make them real), adapting them as practical tools for Setian Xeper.

structure_content.chapter_title: [19] A Spell for Crossing the Desert
structure_content.summary: Presents an operative formula of Xepera Xeper Xeperu, linked to ancient Egyptian spells for survival and self-creation. It is a statement of one's Coming Into Being as creator, intended to strengthen the mind/soul for navigating the 'unknown desert' of difficult experiences.

structure_content.chapter_title: [20] Process Philosophy and the Left-Hand Path
structure_content.summary: A detailed philosophical article relating modern Process Philosophy (especially Whitehead's) to Setian philosophy. It differentiates 'becoming' (LHP, creative, organic, unit-events) from 'being' (RHP, static, absolute), providing a robust philosophical grounding for Xeper and Remanifestation.

Outlines a structured, step-by-step system for Setian Black Magic, focusing on choosing the LHP, manifesting the 'Black Flame' into a 'Star of Darkness,' merging with it, and progressing through stages of initiation (Dark Disciple, Dark Initiate, ascended Black Master) towards Dark Transfiguration and godhood.

Explains the 'Crystal Tablet of Set' as a clear, exquisite, and fragile document that resonates with the Elect, crystallizing information into a formula for self-empowerment. It likens Xeper to navigating a maze of rooms, where Black Magic serves as a key.

key_concepts.definition: The central Setian concept of self-creation, becoming, and individual evolution into a god-like state. It is an active, ongoing process of transforming oneself and one's subjective universe.
A magical path focused on individualization, self-deification, and imposing one's will on reality, distinct from RHP traditions which seek union with a universal deity.

Operative magic within the Setian context, aimed at achieving specific goals and manifesting one's will on the objective world, often involving psychological or energetic manipulation. It is a tool for Xeper.
An idealized divine self, visualized and meditated upon within the Vajra Project, not as an external deity but as an aspect of one's own potential to Become.
A technique to actively imagine and make real non-existent states or capabilities, directly linking inner will to outer manifestation, serving as a tool for Xeper.
A high initiatory stage where the lower self merges with the Form of Set, leading to a trans-human, eternal Set-like existence, free of human limitations.

A tool for Xeper involving the conscious observation and separation of one's true self from the mechanical 'functions' (emotional, moving, instinctive, intellectual) to gain control and direct personal evolution.

A philosophical framework, particularly from Whitehead, emphasizing 'becoming' and creativity as fundamental aspects of reality, providing a robust intellectual foundation for Setian concepts like Xeper and Remanifestation.
Internal entities birthed from one's own nature, to be recognized, named, and integrated by the magician, distinct from external infernal spirits.
A symbolic representation of the Black Flame blazing forth in one's being, a key stage in Bradley Moore's Black Magic rules, indicating personal salvation and godhood.

practical_system.description: The Scroll of Set outlines a multifaceted practical system for individual Setian initiation and the advancement of the Temple's Great Work. It integrates philosophical understanding (Process Philosophy, Ouspensky's psychology) with direct magical applications. Key operational directives include strategic control of public perception, the use of dance and music for trance and ritual, specialized meditation techniques (Yidam visualization), annual self-assessment and planning ('Year's End'), and specific Black Magical formulas and rules for self-deification and manifesting will. The system emphasizes conscious intent, individual responsibility, and the transformation of the self into a 'Star of Darkness' and eventually an 'ascended Black Master' through the 'Dark Transfiguration.'
tools: Yidam Visualization: Mental construction and meditation upon a personal idealized divine self to guide Xeper.
Awareness & Self-Observation: Applying Ouspensky's framework to differentiate the true self from automatic 'functions' (emotional, moving, instinctive, intellectual).
Conscious Visualization: Proactive mental imaging of desired non-existent states or capabilities to bring them into reality.
Music & Rhythm: Used in rituals (e.g., the Dance Element, Conclave workings) for trance induction, emotional modulation, and amplifying magical power.
Mantra: Specific sacred phrases or names (e.g., Seti er Neheh) for focusing intent during meditation and ritual.
Annual Self-Assessment ('Year's End'): A structured process of reflection, planning, and 'magical bookkeeping' to evaluate progress, identify obstacles, and set intentions for the coming year.
Strategic Disengagement: A 'working' of non-participation in undesirable public forums to conserve and redirect magical energy.
Writing/Documentation (ICR, newsletters): Tools for articulating one's magical work, sharing insights, and contributing to the collective knowledge of the Temple.
Personal Daemons (Internal): Recognizing and integrating one's own internally birthed 'demons' as aspects of one's nature, distinct from external entities.
Black Flame/Star of Darkness: Symbolic internal energetic foci for guiding the process of self-deification.
rituals: Action Tantra Sadhana: A formal ritual for Yidam meditation, involving visualization of an idealized divine self ('Seti er Neheh') and mantra recitation, aiming for apotheosis.

A Spell for Crossing the Desert: An operative formula (Xepera Xeper Xeperu) for strengthening the mind/soul during periods of transition and difficulty, framing personal transformation as a creative act.
The Dance Element: Integration of rhythm and dance into magical workings for trance induction, expressing creative will, and synchronizing group ritual efforts.

Fourteen Rules for Black Magic (Process): A structured, step-by-step initiatory process that is intrinsically ritualistic, guiding the Setian from choice of LHP to Dark Transfiguration and becoming an ascended Black Master.
'alt.satanism Working': A non-engagement strategy treated as a magical 'working' to withdraw energy from an unworthy forum and redirect it to internal Temple advancement.

relevant_quotes.text: The Temple of Set is a living thing. As the vital expression of a consciousness that transcends the human, The Temple is the earthly shadow of an undying principle. As such it is far more than just the sum of each individual Setian.

The Black Magician learns how to view his actions from the perspective of a self-created deity. We strive to see beyond the immediate consequence of our deeds as a Setian, peering into the future to recreate the cosmos according to our will.
The Black Magician is that pioneer who, like many of his brothers, sets out to find something new and bear it back to the Temple.
I dedicate my self unswervingly to my own Xeper. Through my own strength, intelligence, and cunning I will follow the example given by the divine patron of this Temple.

Xeper is not change for the sake of change. We are awake, conscious, vital beings. Should we waste our awareness of self on hedonistic exploits and vain self-aggrandisement? Consider the crystal again. Notice how it slowly forms, slowly evolves and grows, linking molecules to a Set pattern. This is an example of what we should do with our gift of consciousness: evolve it with careful and deliberate effort in the pattern of our absolute potential.

Magicians can send their sayings and doings into the well with conscious intent. Your deeds can be done while being aware/awake that you are doing them to change them all magically, just as you are doing them to change your own life in a rational, linear manner.

Initiation is the process of attaining godhood in several steps. Initiation does not come without hard work and patience. The neter Set provides us with clarity concerning the path to godhood, but we must do the work ourselves.

critical_analysis.relevance: The 'Scroll of Set - December 1998' is highly relevant for understanding the internal discourse, philosophical evolution, and practical applications within the Temple of Set in the late 20th century. It showcases the integration of diverse magical and philosophical traditions (e.g., Ouspensky's psychology, Vajrayana, Chaos Magick, Process Philosophy) into a coherent Left-Hand Path framework centered on Xeper. It addresses both internal community issues (e.g., Internet presence, workshop etiquette, annual planning) and expands upon core Setian doctrines, offering a snapshot of its dynamic development.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Primarily Initiates of the Temple of Set, ranging from I° to IV° and beyond, particularly those interested in the practical application of Xeper, deep philosophical inquiry into Setian principles, and engagement with the broader occult community. Some articles provide foundational insights for new initiates, while others delve into more advanced magical and philosophical concepts for higher degrees.
